text: Ah, Heather Mason. Finally, a female horror protagonist who isn't a DD-cup.

text: Silent Hills is dead in the water :C Kojima and Konami how could you do this to meeeeeeee
author: EazyOleMiss

text: @EazyOleMiss Together, we can only hope for a new installment somewhere in the future. No matter what anyone says, Silent Hill: Downpour was awesome IMO. It shouldn't end here!
author: TheDannyMan

text: Silent Hill always leaves me with this feeling of disturbance (shivers). Very good game and I agree with Postmita, it's the stuff that you hear and don't see and can only imagine that makes it even more creepy. I never finished either because of fear *hhis*.
author: LunarNoire

text: could never finish this game. I got too scared to play by myself when I was in that abandoned office building and could hear squatters or someone walking around but never saw them. Then there was that body in the water under a bridge and when I went and flipped a switch and came back over the bridge the body was gone. I think that's why this and 2 were so scary was the stuff that you couldn't see but imagined was out to get you.
author: Postmita

text: @hotcarl84 I couldnt agree more. Music makes a game as it makes some movies. FF13 is 1 of my fave FF's for its incredible soundtrack
author: MtMarshi

text: This game really didn't have much music, which adds to the tension whenever music actually starts playing: You're just expecting something to happen that most probably never actually comes. The first 3 SH games were amazing (Coming from someone who usually hates horror games/movies/books/whatevers with a passion), the rest were mediocre to bad.
author: masterplusmargarita

text: @tangramman He did the same thing with Love Psalm, which I found hard to like because of it, but once you get used to it, it's a fabulous song as well. This is one is more actual ambient, and I find that ambient music rarely leads anywhere so it feels easier to accept somehow, than it was with Love Psalm which is rock-based.

text:
I love his work too, especially You're Not Here and Laura's Theme. I went to Play! A Video Game Symphony hoping to hear some of his work; the orchestra apparently had no time to rehearse it. D:

Hopefully I'll get my fill at Video Games Live.

Catches that spooky dark ambience but is still very catchy with that funky drum beat.
